website_summaries.verdict: If you need a video doorbell on a budget, this offering from Remobell’s decent video resolution, handy night vision and low price are worth a look.
pros: Motion sensors and button send alerts to your smart device

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality and motion detection
customer_reviews.text: When I moved to new home last year, I was looking for a Doorbell due to recent burglary but didn't want to spend too much money. Compared with others in the same price range, this offered best video quality and motion detection. It's been only 2 weeks but the blue ring give me a piece of mind when I come home in the evening.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: I also really wanted to like it but did not work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and it did not work on my house. It would freeze up after 1 hour of use. I tried 2 different ones, worked with their very helpful support team but we could not get it to work. We even tried connecting to 2 diff WIFI's I have at home and no luck. I also did not like the supposed 1080p image, which looks more like 720p. I ended up paying $100 more for RING and so far its been up for 2 week no issues and the images are much better.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ordonez

customer_reviews.title: Clear video; easy install
customer_reviews.text: Installation: Relatively easy. There are multiple wall plates, allowing you to choose the best viewing angle for your needs. Remo+ includes drill bit, screw driver (for the various screws). The doorbell started talking to me to help me complete the installation! Video Quality: Excellent. It's clear & easy to view. There is a live view option to see what's going on. Two Way Communication: I can talk to the person at the door. Overall design: I like it - not very big; will light up when it detects motion. Already got a few compliments on the nice looking doorbell!
customer_reviews.author: Larry T

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: After trying it out for a few weeks, this video doorbell detects motion much faster than any of the other video doorbells I've seen. The picture quality is great and the night vision is also really clear. I like that I can choose the areas where the doorbell detects motion and even lower or increase the sensitivity of the motion detectors if I want to. As far as installation goes, it was pretty straight forward and I had no problems connecting it to my WiFi network. I even connected it to my Echo show with no problems. Overall, it's a really great product and I'm glad I found it.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Complete Crap
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are a joke. No schematic, no troubleshooting information, and the support website has virtually no information. Hooking it up, the chime just rings over and over, and the bell is never powered. What the hell does the "power kit" do? Nobody knows. How do you connect it? Nobody knows. The documentation is ridiculously oversimplified and well, that would be ok if it worked, but it does not, and there's no way to figure it out. And by the way, "works with Google Home" is a lie. You can ask Google the battery status. That's it. Stream the video to your home hub? Nope. Tell you when someone is at the door? Nope. Return to sender.
customer_reviews.author: David Schneck

customer_reviews.title: Should have spent the extra $100 for a better brand
customer_reviews.text: This has poor picture quality. Glitches all the time. Catches motion of cars on the street, but misses people walking up the porch steps.
customer_reviews.author: Just Mom

customer_reviews.title: WOW, great product
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews but I love this. Returned 2 others including Ring brand, this is way better. Love it. Looks awesome too. Weird that you had to add something to internal doorbell chime but it was easy. App is really great lets you delete or download to your phone for permanent free storage. Way better live connection than other doorbells I tried. A smaller Philips screwdriver that came with it will help. Highly recommend! Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Scott S

customer_reviews.title: This company has no idea what they are doing. Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking this would be an upgrade from Ring. I was wrong. I couldn't even sign up for an account with iOS. I figured out that you had to sign up while only while cell signal (WTF), after that the app would continually pop up with errors and lose connection with the doorbell. Even after successfully connecting the doorbell to WiFi, I could not see anything. I've been in hardware development for a long time. This company has a ton of VC funding but is shipping hot garbage. Don't bother, they'll be gone soon.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, Easy Install.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality build. Easy to install; includes everything needed to install. Good picture including night vision. Two way talk. Live view. No monthly subscription. This door cam does everything I need without breaking the bank. How it looks; Picture on left is recorded view and picture on right is live view.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie G.

customer_reviews.title: Product failed; support is sub-par
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in June and installed it within a couple of days of receipt. Last month, the camera failed: all images are pink. After going through several troubleshooting steps with REMO+, they determined that it failed. I have to return it to them (at my cost), wait for them to receive it, and then they will send me a refurbished device. This is not acceptable policy. Failure within a couple of months is indicative of a manufacturing defect, that they should replace and then wait for me to return the faulty one. I am left with wires hanging out of my doorframe for who knows how long.
customer_reviews.author: rk1000

customer_reviews.title: Remo+ S: Don't waste your money...
customer_reviews.text: If it seems too good to be true, it probably is. This shiny package promised ease of use and high-tech app-enabled viewing of my front door area. Hmmm. While it wired up easy enough, the performance was unbelievably poor. Video and audio stuttering, buggy beta-quality app, failed doorbell ringer and more problems plagued my experience. Customer service (difficult to reach), was not helpful, and tried to blame the internet speed. While not the fastest, it is DSL service that works for everything else we throw at it. Oh well, I wasted a day on this, but at least I get a refund on this very poor product.
customer_reviews.author: SteveRoberts

customer_reviews.title: Great product hardware, software/app need some improvement
customer_reviews.text: Camera and hardware seems very good and is well made. Good design. Good looking. Easy installation. However, the software/app has some shortcomings. Motion detection is very sensitive and motion detection zone selection needs to be refined if used in higher activity areas. Adjusting sensitivity down helps, but still lots of false triggers, not clear in video what triggered the detection, possibly delayed recording by the device. The settings options in the app is not intuitive and needs to include some descriptions of what each settings actually control. Overall, very good for the price if comparing to the $200-$300 models out there. Hopeful of Remo sending out software updates, if so it will sell out easily!
customer_reviews.author: I enjoy good wine

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this video doorbell a couple of weeks ago and was very disappointed with the installation instructions but got the doorbell hooked up in a couple of hours and functioning. While the picture was clear both day and night shots, when the doorbell rings there is no chime that alerts you and settings are bare bones. This doorbell functioned well enough for the first eight days and then just died. I followed instructions to reset per manual and nothing. For the price, it does what it should while it worked. I am sending this back and biting the bullet for the Nest.
customer_reviews.author: jghudson1

customer_reviews.title: Night vision is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product, easy to install and works great. Check your transformer if you are planning to use the mechanical chimes, I needed to or a 16 volt 30va transformer it will be here tomorrow. Notifications are fast and communication is clear., I installed it at my mom's house, showed my brothers and they will be ordering for their houses.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great Smart Doorbell
customer_reviews.text: I love the REMO S Door bell. I have a LaView, and a Ring. The Ring is very large (the Ring original) and requires a subscription service. The LaView was similar but it did not do anything for the longest time and then started working. The REMO S worked from installation to now. NOo subscription service, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart Marshall

customer_reviews.title: So far the best i have used
customer_reviews.text: I have used so many doorbell cameras in a ditch effort to void Google or Ring, and this is by far the best looking and best performing doorbell camera i have used thus far. could Ring be better, maybe, but I'm not going to find out because I found the one! The one downside to this camera is that all notifications are displayed as "Detected Motion" even if it's someone ringing the doorbell. I wish they would display, "Someone is at your door" it has free 3-day cloud storage(or 7, i can't remember), but mine has every single event accessible since installed 1 month ago. I would recommend this camera
customer_reviews.author: Charlie B.

customer_reviews.title: The most beautiful doorbell
customer_reviews.text: The design caught my eyes and that was the main reason why I ordered it. It was my first video doorbell, so I can't compare it to the similar products from other companies, but it was pretty easy to install. They even included a drill bit in the box, which was a pleasant surprise. The build quality is good and I especially liked the button. It feels like clicking Macbook touchpad. The video quality also is good for $99 doorbell, and most importantly, it's been working great without any issue. Overall, I would say it's a nice product.
customer_reviews.author: WJ

customer_reviews.title: When I bought the Remo the motion detection did not work. With the new update it works well
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to update my review of this device. When I bought the Remo the motion detection did not work. it took Remo over 3 months to come out with an update to the firmware to resolve the issue. They kept promising next week, next week, but eventually about 3 months later they released a update to the firmware that resolved the problem. The system now works as intended and is a good value
customer_reviews.author: B. Swope

customer_reviews.title: After studying for a month, I went with REMOBell S
customer_reviews.text: So many different brands, price ranges, monthly fees, Pros & Cons.... Many mix of reviews for this item. For what I wanted and expected, RemoBell S delievered. No (Stupid) monthly fees for cloud usage. (keeps video for 3 days only, which is great) Video is clear, sound quality is great, and motion detection is working great. Installation wasn't easy... After 1 month of use, I am 100% satisfied. Its less then $100....
customer_reviews.author: Claire Kim

customer_reviews.title: Quality product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: This doorbell is a quality product and works well. The picture quality is great and the notifications are fast. The night vision is only adequate. We had an issue installing but customer service was quick to respond. The issue ended up not being anything to do with the new doorbell, but rather the old doorbell transformer that was originally installed when the house was built. One drawback is the video feed can't be linked to Google Home, so you can't see the video feed, only on your phone or ipad. Google may allow that to change down the road though. It's simple and for the price, you can't go wrong with this doorbell.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried others but this is by far the best one yet. EASILY connects to existing doorbell wires. One IMPORTANT FACTOR when installing though that the directions don't mention is that BEFORE it chimes (mechanical chime) the app MUST be downloaded and you have to go in and select the chime (mechanical/electronic) or it won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Juco

customer_reviews.title: Cant find the 'No Stars' button
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a disappointment, this is the view I have had for the first 24 hours of the device. This is by the way with the Remo S door bell 3 feet away from my router/access point so the signal is probably pretty good. I am also connected to the same router from the phone this picture was captured. I am an IT Project Manager and Wireless Engineer so there is no doubt the signal is not the issue. Someone need to make these door bell things support 5 GHz. Went back in 1 day, thank goodness Amazon Prime is free returns!!
customer_reviews.author: Raiderhader

customer_reviews.title: Great video doorbell.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after my old video doorbell wanted to charge me $100 a year for cloud storage. Did some research and bought the Remo. Basic system gives a top quality picture, 3 days of basic storage (I can buy longer), and works with Alexa. The download is quick. Could not be happier. Install was way easier and work s with my mechanical doorbell.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Feature rich video doorbell at an affordable price!
customer_reviews.text: The RemoBell S Slim Wi-Fi Video doorbell is just what I was looking for in a video doorbell. I needed a video doorbell that was slim enough to fit a narrow door frame. In addition, the RemoBell S has a good quality camera with night vision, two way audio communications, a highly configurable and easy to use app, a well thought set of hardware and instructions for easy installation and setup in various configurations, an inexpensive cloud service, an excellent warranty with theft replacement, and an affordable price. It is great peace of mind knowing that my family and I can monitor activity at the door at any time, and anywhere, with a clear view.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Good cheaper alternative to the Ring
customer_reviews.text: We had a Ring Video doorbell for about 2 years at our condo which we had to get rid of after it malfunctioned due to a power-washer mishap. I got this to replace it and I'm glad I did. It's cheaper, has all or most of the same functionality plus it comes with free 3 days rolling cloud storage so it saves me on ring's yearly subscription cost. It also doesn't cut videos short like the ring does with a max of 30 seconds. Only drawback I can list is the fish-eye playback of recorded videos but I'm hopeful they'll fix that with a software patch eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Deller

customer_reviews.title: Great value door bell with an impressive array of customizable options
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the ease-of-use of the app, excellent motion detection with adjustable sensitivity, and night vision as well. You can also customize the “motion zone” which works well for our house because we have trees right outside the door and bustling of those leaves could trigger the motion sensor but by restricting the motion zone we no longer had false positives.
customer_reviews.author: Jae K.

customer_reviews.title: Remo Just Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Speaking from experience with Skybell, Ring, and Vivint, Remo is the superior doorbell camera. Easy to set up, responds so quick to detected motion it is almost immediate. Camera has not produced a false alert yet. The Remo+ app is simple to use and works flawlessly. I tried this unit because of a very good product review in PC Magazine and a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska_Haze

customer_reviews.title: Tooo sensitive and poor night vision
customer_reviews.text: Too sensitive. It's detecting nothing, but recording everything. Thought it was wind moving a tree, nope. Adjustment down to nothing just to keep it from going off every minute. Reduced zone area, still same. Night visions a joke. It barely sees anything and up that to high. If this goes off every minute, whose going tio pay attention to anything? They need to work on settings and sensitivity or lack of night vision.
customer_reviews.author: Ali R

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: It does what I need it to, with no apparent (or at least significant enough to be noticeable) video lag time. Image quality is good enough, not great. Can also use talk feature, though lag time is noticeable there. No monthly subscription is probably its biggest plus over others. Overall, great value, hoping it stands the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Was expecting more based on ads.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, and application is easy to use if you figure out what each option does. I needed to build an user manual via email with TechSupport. Night vision is below average and the camera creates a lot of false positive when lights are turned on/of, insects or even when a cloud suddenly cover a shiny sun.It is a expensive doorbell that at least does not charge a monthly subscription fee.
customer_reviews.author: AJBR

customer_reviews.title: Sad and Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: I carefully followed all instructions and worked through e-mails with the manufacturer to troubleshoot the problem but the thing won't give a clear picture and they won't give a refund either. They are blaming it on slow internet speed, although data proves that we exceed their requirements. I recommend buying from a company with better support system.
customer_reviews.author: Mini Vice

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several different video doorbells and this one works. They included everything you need for install. The connection process did not work as well as I expected and required a call to customer support for help. Once working it did well, however my inside doorbell does not ring when the button is pushed.
customer_reviews.author: JRINC

customer_reviews.title: Love the Remo S
customer_reviews.text: Great video doorbell for the price. Good video quality during the day, and pretty good at night, though the night vision "light" could be father reaching. The app is good, and your notification speed on your phone of motion and rings is very quick, which is important. What really sets Remo apart from Ring is that their cloud-serviced retention of past video events is free - Ring's requires an ongoing subscription. That's a cost savings that adds up at $30-$100 a year, depending upon the plan you choose. I didn't want another subscription, but I did want to be able to review past footage, so the Remo fit the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wurth

customer_reviews.title: It's just average.
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for 3 months now. The motion sensor is finicky. It only records for 30 seconds after motion is set off. A lot of the time the motion is tripped by a fly or headlights hitting the fence across the street. And sometimes it doesn't go off at all. My son's bike was stolen right from in front of this doorbell cam 2 nights ago.
customer_reviews.author: Blake T. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Best thing about this is the price. Bad- 1. when someone presses the door bell it makes a loud sound my neighbor knows I have a guest. But then my phone doesnt give me door bell notification sound. 2.i put low settings sensitivity, still catches cars or nothing outside. False call. Cant adjust zones. 3. Video quality is bad. Sound is actually not bad. For the price I'll take the quality. But the app needs more work to make friendly user interface. Add more options for sounds, notifications and zoning.
customer_reviews.author: Dima D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, easy-to-use budget option
customer_reviews.text: This is the only system I have personal experience with, purchased after lots of comparison shopping and e-research. All the research and recommendations indicated this was a good device and a smart choice, and it's held up its end of the bargain. Installation and set-up were straightforward, app is easy to use, picture is clear and works well on both wifi and cellular data. Two items that I'd like to see a little improvement on are lag (detection/notification seems a little slower than I'd expect/prefer) and detection nuance (still not able to perfect my zones and sensitivity). But for the price (~$80 when I got it) I'm MORE than willing to manage those issues.
customer_reviews.author: P. Goddard

customer_reviews.title: There's a ghost at my door
customer_reviews.text: Last night is when we really noticed it, the doorbell starting ringing, so I thought someone was at my door. Looked at the camera, no one there but the bugs. It happened again, again, and again. Today I turned off the doorbell. I left the room, and all of a sudden it was like someone standing on the porch just constantly pushing the button. I looked at the camera and again nothing. Then it stopped. I don't know if this doorbell has a flaw, or if it is a gateway for spirits but it is certainly annoying my dogs. So for that reason, I give it a thumbs down!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Jameson-Leaver

customer_reviews.title: Why Didn't We Do THIS Sooner?!?!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous product! We can't seem to get it hooked up to our old doorbell, but we don't care because it pops up on our phones, and we're never without those. In fact, we are able to talk to people at our door while we're out of the state. Fabulous! All 3 of us living in the house have the app on our phone. We disabled the motion sensor because it's very sensitive and we didn't need to know every time the neighbor's cat visited our door. LOL!
customer_reviews.author: Barbi Holdeman

customer_reviews.title: Give yourself enough time to install. Don’t rush.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t get it installed. I should have tried harder. The included attach wires don’t sit flat to remote. That along with wire ties that would not accept included wires with existing wires. Even if they did work there was not enough room to stuff everything behind remote. Also not happy with dongle for computer for alerts.
customer_reviews.author: Eccomarco

customer_reviews.title: We went to Canada for vacation and we were answering door ring to our home in United states.
customer_reviews.text: I like the most customer service! These days once they sold their goods there is no clear way to access customer service. My power kit wasn't working and they send me extra power kit very quick and FREE! I do suggest to create different accounts for each viewer that way we all can determine the motion sensitivity level. I'm very busy with my phone open and that really bother me. However my wife like to keep an eye on it. Also at night... some tiny insects flying around will activate the sensor. Seems very sensitive. Overall we are very happy about this product and recommend for others.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel T.

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up if you understand your doorbell system.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you understand the different kind of doorbells you should first find your system at Amazon or on line so you will understand the set up directions. Next you need to know that you are adding another wifi item to your network and that to many item will take away from it running the way you may expect it to. When I first set up my Remo and added it to my system it worked great but when a lot of wi fi items were in use it would drop the bell first. I put an extender in and hooked the Remo to it and it stopped dropping. Very please at this time. Tom Bailey
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying it
customer_reviews.text: The company should work on their app. It’s not good enough. The reply video came black in the beginning. Customer Service is unreachable by phone. Email response is better. They’ve said to turn the HD video quality to Low to fix the issue until they fixed it. What’s the point of having low quality camera! Overall - nice gadget for the money.
customer_reviews.author: John Constantine

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Happy
customer_reviews.text: It has good video and the playback is awesome. Once I was able to get the motion Detection set right, it’s great. Not sure about the free cloud storage, because I got a notice today that my ‘trial’ was up and if I wanted to continue with cloud storage I needed to purchase. Either $3.00 a month or $30.00 a year. To me that’s not free. I think the wording should be changed to free trial cloud storage. They give you 30 days from activation. I could have chosen to keep the videos on my phone, but that takes up space. Anyway over all, I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: not easy to install if you have a dual frequency wifi router
customer_reviews.text: I like its looks, compact and slim. as in the feature ratings, its pretty good. It was not easy to get running because you can only set it up with a smartphone on 2.4 ghz wifi frequency and my router is dual channel with preference for 5 ghz. I finally got help from a capable ATT tech support who set up another account within my router at 2.4 ghz. So with connection I could view movement at my front door but no push notifications for movement or doorbell ring. My issue has now been moved up to engineering, so I get the impression this technology is not quite ready for prime time.
customer_reviews.author: MODESTOJIM

customer_reviews.title: This doorbell has destroyed me
customer_reviews.text: It worked for about a week and then stopped working. We reset it four or five times, deleted and reinstalled the app, but the app will not add the device back on. For the few days it worked it seemed like a great product, now I want to burn my house down if I have to try going through the add device process one more time
customer_reviews.author: Anne H.

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your $
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for several months and have attempted to engage support. Forgot trying the phone, I emailed them only to get “oh yea that feature does not work “bugged” no idea when the software fix will come. No software updates to fix their stinking “bug”. The alerts get set off by insects All you can record is this poor “fish eye” recordings. It was not worth the money! Product stinks support stinks!
customer_reviews.author: Grams

customer_reviews.title: Zero product support.  More like a Prototype, improvement needed.
customer_reviews.text: + Installation is easy. Worked right off. Nice fisheye picture. + Runs off the 24VAC doorbell power, instead of a battery. No periodic charging required. - In iPad landscape mode, live video is often upside down. iPhone OK - Video recall only works in portrait mode - Live View times out in ~60s. An option to keep the video view on as long as desired, is needed, possibly w/o recording to the cloud. - Device makes multiple entries in "Port Forwarding" section of the router, which may affect performance. I notice ~100.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy install, software activation was a little bit tricky on my iphone.
customer_reviews.text: I like the mounting bracket options and the fact that the wires are hardwired to the back of the unit, unlike the Ring which I did not like. Software on smart phone decent, not many options. Instructions are a little fuzzy in regard to the procedure if you have a mechanical vs. an electronic chime doorbell. I have the mechanical doorbell on the wall which doesn't require you to have to use the included power module. Overall I like this model, will see how it stands up to the winter and the afternoon sun being that it on the west side of the house. I did not have to call tech support, so this is why I gave 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: THIS NOT GOOGLE HOME COMPATIBLE.
customer_reviews.text: The video is torn and has ribbons of pixelation. It does not have a pre buffer for video just prior to motion detected like some others. Night vision is not good. And even though some reviews say it is Google assistant compatible it is not. Try looking for an app for this through Google home...you will find NOTHING. This was one of the reasons I bought this and then was VERY disappointed. No firmware updates since I bought it in 2019. I will search for something better. I suggest you do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Buwanaskee

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service- never answer phones
customer_reviews.text: Finally remo bell S WiFi is working but horrible customer support, in which it only communicates via email and screenshots over 5 weeks without success Customer service located in CA in pacific time zone do living in nyc-, I could never reach but I kept leaving messages 2-3x a week w/o capacity to leave messages but just direct to utube set up. Finally paid $100 for a tech savvy person to connect WiFi. Ugh more money than the remo bell, and tech had lots of challenges with WiFi connection taking over an hour for what should have been easy WiFi set up. Yes it’s working now but time n money ridiculous. Do not buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is the first doorbell camera we tried so I was initially excited but I immediately found out why the price was so much lower than competitors. The packaging was nice, easy advertising and sturdy. The product was easy to get to and the directions were clear. The app was easy to find and setup but the downfall was the camera quality. It was very poor compared to the major brands in this space and we had to go with another product to get the value we originally wanted.
customer_reviews.author: ElMusago

customer_reviews.title: No problem at all. Paid full price. Happy customer.
customer_reviews.text: Just installed and it has everything you need for installation including a drill bit and a leveler, screw drivers. You need to tweak app setting in order to make it work properly especially if you have mechanical chime. Sensitivity setting is pretty detailed for day and night separately. I uses both 5ghz and 2.4ghz and I have no problem with both activated. Of course this one only uses 2.4ghz. This company is South Korean company and they have been this industry for more than 10 years they are NOT Chinese if you care. For me, this is a big relief to me. Picture quality is beyond HD but it record only fish eye mode.
customer_reviews.author: AncientMan

customer_reviews.title: Pure junk
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is pure junk. The first one died after two week and the second one lasted 4 hours. So I put my August one back up and use it even though it has a delay in it. It took support over a month to get back with me after emailing and left voicemails to them. They blamed my system but when I told them the other system I have works but not as fast as I want it to they went Oh. There excuse was they are a small group and overwhelmed and that should tell you what there products is like. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Johndale

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: We are so unhappy with this doorbell!! We had another doorbell that connected to our WiFi but it was a rechargeable battery. But it never disconnected from the WiFi. We got tired of recharging it so we (thought) we were upgrading to one that connected to our doorbell electric. BIG MISTAKE BIG MISTAKE. It’s a pain in the butt. It doesn’t stay connected. We would NEVER EVER recommend this product. Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Donna S. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Shakey start but great ongoing.
customer_reviews.text: First one worked for an hour before failing but the second plugged in and ran. I had a couple of issues with the app that were corrected with an update. Tech support is a little slow in the inital response but the response was worthwhile and makes you feel valued. The motion sensing would be easier if there were an image in the adjustment window but works well. It replaced a Ring and the speed of receiving a motion response is significantly faster with the Remo. Overall replacing the Ring was one of the best things that I have done and i am very happy with the Remo+S
customer_reviews.author: TheOldTeddyBear

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Works great! One of the best experiences I have had with a DIY electronic appliance. Great packaging with all you need, easy installation and it worked great as soon as I turned the power back on.... even with my lousy internet and WIFI speeds. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Spartz

customer_reviews.title: I would like recommend.  Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and it can within24 hours. Easy to set up hardware. Software, meh 😖. Tried over and over to sign up. Finally when reading reviews saw some one used iPhone successfully. I was able to do that. My galaxy 10 didn't work. After that it was all cake! Additional viewers easy. Pucture great. One problem inside bell doesn't ring so I have to buy add on. Old house low voltage. Still a win because many new electronics I'm not able to hardwire into house.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This doorbell has great reviews, but the video quality is so poor I don't understand it.
customer_reviews.text: I did not use the doorbell for more then an evening. The village of quality was so poor, I decided to return it immediately. It is listed as HD, but it looks more like 8-bit video games from the 80s. I did a lot of research and I've had very good reviews on YouTube. But I'm disappointed. A car some 30 feet away you can't even see that it has a license plate. I decided to spend twice as much, $199 for the ring doorbell number three. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: artvark

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but some glitches
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality and instant notifications are great. The motion detecting is too sensitive, even on the lowest setting. Constant notifications when cars drive by the house. Also, you may have to get a higher output transformer. This may be difficult to locate in your house. Mine was attached to the furnace. Picture is very clear. Love the 2 way talk feature.
customer_reviews.author: Tom K.

customer_reviews.title: Better than ring and cheaper.
customer_reviews.text: Great doorbell I purchased a ring initially 6 months later the thing had poor video quality and wasn't turning on but about half the time... Called ring they said it was out of warranty and recommended I buy the newest version, I said I'll be buying another video doorbell but it won't be a ring. So I bought this. Video quality is better, motion detection is better, software is better, it's faster, the app is not quite as flexible and needs some work but not faulting it on that alone.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Connecting issues
customer_reviews.text: The doorbell itself seems like a solid product. It comes with a few different faceplate so you can get the angle you want. For the life of me, it would not connect with my phone. I tried my wife's phone with the same results. (I have an Android and she has an iPhone) I watched YouTube videos on trouble shooting. Got on their website for support. Nothing worked. I really liked the idea of 3 day free cloud storage and it seemed to have great reviews, but didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the money and no monthly fees.
customer_reviews.text: Been happy so far. Only issue was the first one I was sent was defective. Unfortunately I wasted a few hours troubleshooting before giving up and ordering a replacement. Plugged in the replacement and has been going strong ever since. Would be nice if the motion zones were more detailed. My Blink has many grids, maybe 100 or more, that you can deactivate motion detection, but this only has 5 zones.
customer_reviews.author: King K

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok, barely
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a few months now and I would say I am barely satisfied. The image “quality” is not bad, however it suffers greatly with the internet connection, even after reconfigurations to my internet it still has a very poor connection, so what you are left with are some nice “still” images that update every few seconds (if that) while it buffers endlessly. For the money I’d say it’s “ok” but if you want seamless video playback look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Some bloke

customer_reviews.title: Great but one important feature missing...
customer_reviews.text: Motion works well, and I get instant notification on my Android phone most of the time. However, if someone pushes the button, there is no notification. Motion tends to take a lower priority and most people, myself included, at times will ignore motion notifications. What if someone is actually at my door pushing the button and I am not at home or in a place where I cannot hear my mechanical chimes? There should be a distinct notification, such as a doorbell sound, on my phone when the button is pushed. Disappointing. I so want to rip this out and get another brand. I will wait a few more months in hopes the manufacturer will add this feature.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ware

customer_reviews.title: Good quality video door bell
customer_reviews.text: I installed the video door bell about three weeks ago on my front door. It’s working very well and I’m pleased with the product. I only have one complaint, at night when it’s foggy it sees the fog and it looks like a snow flurry and this triggers the motion sensor. I tried lowering the sensitivity and lowering the illumination but it still triggered the motion detector. I had to turn the night illumination off, but that’s OK, since I have a motion sensor porch light and the doorbell works fine with the light from the porch light. No more false wake ups at 3am. This really is a good product and I’m glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Not for the average person
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are an expert at installing both hardware and software I would suggest that you stay away from this product. I tried calling their support line and you get a recording. this was at 3 in the afternoon. of course they are busy, people like me are calling asking how to set up this alarm!
customer_reviews.author: gonzodogg

customer_reviews.title: Video quality is fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: What a great doorbell camera it's thin low profile works great. I installed it at my mom's house so I can keep an eye on her driveway and what a delay even my mom who cannot use technology can use this just fine. I had to sideload the app into her Amazon fire tablet which worked fine. would have been a little bit easier if they had it on the Amazon app store. I highly recommend this over any other doorbell camera out there that I have seen so far. Including ring.
customer_reviews.author: NhscanDotCom

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: It took a few months for my husband to install, but now that its in, we really like it! Its the perfect finishing touch for our home security system. It is a bit sensitive (although I have adjusted the senditivity on the app) because it chimes if a butterfly or wasp flies by, or if it is windy outside, but it does its job. I love that you monitor it yourself from your phone and that you can see who it is snd talk to them. Great value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: David/Myrna Sanders

customer_reviews.title: You get more for your money with RemoBell S!
customer_reviews.text: Price and quality is unbeatable. Free cloud storage for 3 days. I have the RemoBell S for 2 weeks now. Picture and audio quality is great. Notifications are quick. Remo+ app is easy to set up and use. Night vision is good but if you have a night light by the door it is better to leave it on normal vision setting. Only bad thing is that during the day, if the camera has a lot of light in focus then you only see asilhouette of a a person coming to the door (see my photos) It's not always like that, depends on the position where the person is and how bright is the background.
customer_reviews.author: Senaid Zecevic

customer_reviews.title: They Grew too fast
customer_reviews.text: left 2 voicemails with number, no call back. Sent emails with details of install, support asked delay questions, answers were in the original email. This company has grown so fast they are failing customers. Do not fall for PC Mag article, that was before they grew fast.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: simple and elegant
customer_reviews.text: This product is simple and elegant; although thicker than it appears in images. There aren't many advanced features, however, it does the job and have everything you need. Pro: I don't think they intended you to use it this may but you can silence your doorbell by selecting none instead of mechanical or digital. This is good a DND mode. I wish this feature could be scheduled or there was a quick toggle. Con: The video is very fisheye. When you are watching live it can correct the image, however, you lose some edges. Also, watching recorded video I don't see this as an option.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D.

customer_reviews.title: Massive waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: I am so upset with myself that I waited to install. I am a single family home owner, and alot of the installation I was not able to do by myself. This was advertised as battery opperated, but it had to be wired into my house. After going through quite to ordeal to get it installed, it wouldn't connect to my wifi. I tried to contact customer service, but when I called, you get a message saying if you wanted to speak with someone, you have to make an appointment. Dealing with customer service was just as infuriating. Needless to say, I have a new doorbell that doesnt work.
customer_reviews.author: jeanette cruz

customer_reviews.title: great doorbell
customer_reviews.text: This is a great doorbell. Works awesome. Would recommend. However.....the documentation is lacking if you have certain issues. A solid red light can mean low power but nothing about it in the doc. After i returned a couple i realized i needed a new transformer and after that it is flawless
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: REMOBELL S YOUR BASIC DOORBELL CAM
customer_reviews.text: Having experience with a name brand competitor I find the Remobell S lacking. The 180 degree view is not 180 degree in my opinion. If you have a porch light on you cannot see into the darkness. Settings are very basic not as much control as with the competitor. Picture quality in my opinion is not as good as claimed. My playback is not working properly it is nothing but a black screen, very disappointing. Bottom line in my opinion if your wanting security go with the name brand competitor if you want a toy go with Remo, half the price half the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Security
customer_reviews.text: Use the doorbell for approximately three weeks. Excellent picture quality. Fast confirmation of movement near the doorbell. Have a bright light that burns all night near the doorbell so the night vision has not been tested. Feel more comfortable with this doorbell installed.
customer_reviews.author: W W Payne

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the attached photos, there is a difference between the live view and the saved view. A minor annoyance. The motion sensor does seem to be far too sensitive even after adjusting. Also, when first installed my mechanical doorbell would not sound when depressing the Remo button; however, after checking again a few hours later it works just find. Don't know why that happened. Love the three-day save of videos for free.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: The quality was not that good and the image it captured was fisheye. Another reason was backlighting like the sun or snow made the capture to dark to really be recognizable. I ended by a eufy doorbell and motion cameras and am extremely happy, much better quality of images, backlight much improved and the night time vision was a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Remo???? ..... seriously
customer_reviews.text: The detection is super slow.... Often times it will detect motion, but the camera barely catches an image. Also, if you set this up at your house, you should make sure that your door ball transformer is at the highest power available, otherwise the transformer bwill pop and you will have to buy a new one. I went through 4 stransformers.
customer_reviews.author: Dougan

customer_reviews.title: The product works well, but no inside bell anymore.
customer_reviews.text: Product works great. Installation was easy. But inside bell no longer works. Manual says there is probably not enough power to ring it, then also shows an assessory to buy for inside the house that rings with the outside device. I decided to save spending any more money and have Alexa tell us when the bell rings.
customer_reviews.author: FMulligan

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects the WiFi too often
customer_reviews.text: Door bell keeps on disconnecting from the WiFi and stays solid red. Very frustrating because i have to unplug from the chime to reconnect it so it can go blue. Pressing the reset button for 5 seconds doesn't make the light goes from red to blue, but remains solid red. Tried to have tech support but it's unavailable from amazon at this moment. I would like tech support before i could return it for an exchange, otherwise i will have to change product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The overall product quality, attention to details, documentation and accompanying hardware is very good. I just have two qualms about it: - picture quality is substandard for the recorded pictures; it is ok for the live-view - recorded pictures appear only in fisheye mode. - I think to cover more ground, they have over-exaggerated the focal length of the lens and it is overly fish-eyed.
customer_reviews.author: Great Zod

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: The physical installation was straightforward and didn't take much time or effort at all. The issues began when trying to connect to WiFi. Our WiFi meets all of the requirements, but it simply will not connect. We even moved the router closer to be sure that it was within range and it still wouldn't connect. It looks nice, but is essentially useless if it won't connect to the WiFi network. We'll be returning this tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Works fine. Best feature is the free 3 day cloud storage. Very easy to download and save videos. Stored video files are in a fish eye format although live video feeds are in a normal HD format. They said they will correct this in a future app update.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Died after 8 months; poor customer service too
customer_reviews.text: This worked well until it suddenly died. I tried to go through the reset procedure before contacting the company, but the unit was completely dead so the reset failed. I also checked the power to the unit, which was working fine. I contacted the company via email [per their voicemail recommendation when I called], and despite my telling them all of this, several days later they replied that I should go through the reset procedure. I contacted them AGAIN asking for a replacement. Silence. So I've been without a doorbell for about 10 days now. Not a happy camper here.....
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Serious Wifi issues - Video quality issues
customer_reviews.text: Have had the Remo Bell for almost a year now. The quality of video has degraded immensley since installing it. If you're running on a mesh network with both 5 and 2.4G signals you'll have problems most likely. Video is grainy and serious latency on the doorbell. Network connectivity says signal is good to the doorbell but the doorbell itself says signal is always bad. Support is slow and willing to blame your network vs trying to solve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Vailliencourt

customer_reviews.title: Great Motion Sensor Doorbell
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been using the RemoBell S for the past several months, we love the design of the doorbell and appreciate the notification of someone at our door. My wife wasn't overly intrigued when I bought the doorbell, but she's loved the product since I installed it. The app is very friendly and easy to use, and notification happens quickly, and we are avid promoters of the RemoBell.
customer_reviews.author: Bush

customer_reviews.title: Great Security Option
customer_reviews.text: Good resolution, easy install (I purchased the plugin wiring transformer), NO batteries and always on. This provides an extra level of security, it may not stop all the bad things from happening, but it is a good 'deterrent'. Especially like the cloud based FREE storage, yes, you can subscribe and get a higher level of service, but you really do not need more than what they provide for free.
customer_reviews.author: George L.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase 👍
customer_reviews.text: I can't give a true report on tech support because I don't need it, the thing just works and works well. I catch all the Beer Bro's and Wine Fairies that try and stealthy drop gifts off on the porch. Setup is easy IF you read the instructions, don't know why I didn't think of that for the first 10 minutes.🤔 After READING the instructions it was quick and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Conradt

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money -  choose differently
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it because reviews were strong and I didn’t have to purchase additional service Plans. Motion sensor picks up wind and small plants loving even after changing sensitivity setting. Now recordings are black until 30 seconds into recording. I wish I could return but I’ve missed the window. I even had Handyman install to make sure it was done right . The Apple app has poor reviews and I didn’t notice until I went to install the app on my phone. I wish I would have spend the extra money for a Ring.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M.

customer_reviews.title: Remo: well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. Just two wires to connect. Thought I would need a chime, but my old chime worked fine with the Remo. Can be a little sensitive and you get occasional false positives, but overall it works fine, decent video and notifications of motions detected. A bee flew into my portico where I installed the Remo and it detected it. For the price it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Gil

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality WiFi connectivity and over sensitive motion
customer_reviews.text: Very sensitive motion sensing when I got it working (briefly). Very hard to get someone in my doorstep and not someone walking in the street. Adjusted the sensitivity and it didn’t pick up me at all even close by. But the real issue is that it simply stopped working. I hard reset it and got it working again twice but each time it would simply fall off the network and re-adding it through the reset is a torturous procedure as you have to connect via its own network and it tartlet works as it should. Complete waste of money. Bought something else.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Knowles

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: PURCHASED IN MAY. STALL IN MID-OCTOBER CANNOT GET IT TO WORK. TECH SUPPORT WILL NOT RETURN VOICE MAILS. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT - I HAVE WASTED $100 AND DOZENS OF HOURS ON THIS AND CANNOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: A. Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work
customer_reviews.text: After installing Remobell S Wi-Fi Video doorbell camera it wouldn't connect to Wi-Fi. I have both 2.4 Gh and 5.0 Gh Wi-Fi. The door bell worked and was hardwired to my old doorbell. After 5 attempts, I called support and got a recording and couldn't talk to a human. Seems Remo was having another problem with there video, black screen. Also sent an email explaining problem. Then called a friend that does this for a living, he couldn't get it to connect to Wi-Fi either. Returning Remobell camera. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Chartier

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Waste your Money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this based upon PC endorsement. Upon install found out was not compatible with my wifi....I would have to actually switch my router to a slower speed. I suppose this one is garbage and now I will buy a RING like I should have done the first time. Check specs prior to purchase!!! Update...just installed a RING...should have saved $100 and done that from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Stein

customer_reviews.title: Great price, too!
customer_reviews.text: This went right in where our old doorbell was. Nothing to installing it. It even came with a mounting bracket to change the angle! A bit more to get our modem/router to see it. But, it finally came up. We have it on all our devices. We get a ping if there is movement at our front door. The camera is very clear-both night and day. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Karen S.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Item not bad, Nightvision terrible, and the saved videos and nothing like the video you get when motion or bell rang. Also not understanding why after trial i dont get storage, that was why this was chosen so fees would not need to be paid for a week of storage. this is falsely being advertised with free 1 week storage so videos can be downloded for 7 days. The Manufacture need to make this right.
customer_reviews.author: DEBMONT

customer_reviews.title: Expense useless doorbell
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, some nights, it goes off every minute or two, other nights very rarely. It doesn't always catch when some is coming or going. When I reported, they had me send samples and all they could tell me is the my porch rail was the problem. I've been fighting with them on this for almost 2 months and they don't respond to my emails.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl DiLisio

customer_reviews.title: Functions better than a regular door bell for finding out who's at your door
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it got power from the existing door bell wiring and I did not want to fudge with recharing batteries. It Installed easily enough and functions okay in live view. night vision does not work well and for some reason, only records in fisheye which really distorts the image. Would I recommend it? yes. It better than a regular door bell but I cannot say if it's better than the competition
customer_reviews.author: Al . A

customer_reviews.title: Great video doorbell with great picture
customer_reviews.text: I have a mechanical chime, but connecting power pack was very easy, but you must set CHIME MODE in app for the remobell to work with your chime. Would be very helpful if Remo APP asked your chime type during setup. Took me an hour to figure that one out. Once I did, works great. Only had it for a week but for the price, can't be beat. Also, kit came with everything needed including screwdriver and drill bit!!!!
customer_reviews.author: G.Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. Unusable. Pixelated grainy picture. Very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.text: First 3 weeks worked great. No problems at all, raving about it to all my friends. Was even going to get my mom one for her house. Suddenly in the last 3 weeks something happened and the picture has become pixelated and unviewable. Tech support says it's my wifi. Nothing has changed in my house, the router is in the exact same spot. First 3 weeks were perfect. Speed test at the doorbell is 20 down 5 up with my cell phone. I've tried to reset the doorbell, reinstall the app. No help. Basically just a deterrent now. Useless and very disappointed it stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

product_meta.title: Remo+ RemoBell S WiFi Video Doorbell Camera with HD Video, Motion Sensor, 2-Way Talk, and Alexa Enabled (No Monthly Fees) (Free Cloud Storage)
feature_bullets: Powered by existing doorbell wiring (16 –24 VAC) and provides 24/7 surveillance of all front door activity
No monthly subscription fees; records and stores all motion activity for up to 3 days via FREE cloud storage (paid plans available)
Streams all your live videos in high quality HD with 180º wide angle and infrared vision; dewarping option available for live view
Allows you to select areas of interest and sends instant alerts on your smart device when motion is detected in your video doorbell’s view
Lets you see, hear, and talk with visitors from your smartphone or tablet using the Remo+ app (iOS 11 and above, or Android 5 and above)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,400 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
